intro: Filarum, commonly known as the creeping filarum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Filarum is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
